se.soprasteria.automatedtesting.webdriver.api.base

Class BaseTestCase

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.soprasteria.automatedtesting.webdriver.api.base.BaseClass
      • se.soprasteria.automatedtesting.webdriver.api.base.BaseTestCase
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AndroidBaseTestCase, BDDBaseTestCase, BDDFactory, TwitterBaseTest, WebBaseTestCase, YahooBaseTest

    public abstract class BaseTestCase
extends BaseClass
    A base test class to extend when creating selenium test cases. It generates a webdriver using a dataprovider and also quits the webdriver after the test has been run. It also initializes configurations, loggers and properties used by tests.

    Important: Uses propertiesFile and configurationId from the TestNG XML. These specify the path to the properties file and the ID of the webdriver configuration to be used.

      Credentials credentials
      Credentials helper class that pulls credentials from data file (source specified in config

      Mapped testdata to be used in testcases or by dataprovider.
      protected AutomationDriver driver
      WebDriver used by BDD testcases to temporarily store the webdriver used in the tests so that it can be torn down after the test
      java.lang.String propertiesFile
      The propertiesfile path
      java.lang.String testname
      The current test name
      java.lang.String testSuiteName
      The name of this testsuite, assigned when the class is initialized.

        The propertiesfile path

      • data

        protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> data
        Mapped testdata to be used in testcases or by dataprovider. Properties should be named test.data.type.name where type is one of the following [string, int, csv] and name is the name of the variable.

      • driver

        protected AutomationDriver driver
        WebDriver used by BDD testcases to temporarily store the webdriver used in the tests so that it can be torn down after the test

      • testname

        public java.lang.String testname
        The current test name

    • Method Detail

      • getDriver

        @DataProvider(name="getDriver")
public java.lang.Object[][] getDriver(java.lang.reflect.Method testMethod)
                                                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Automatically generates the webdriver used by the tests. You import this by specifying the dataprovider for the annotated test to 'getWebDriver'. For more info about usage please refer to reference testcase.
        Parameters:
        testMethod - Provided by TestNG. Provides information about the testmethod.
        Returns:
        Array with the AutomationDriver object that is being used for the test.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • beforeSuite

        @BeforeSuite(alwaysRun=true)
public void beforeSuite(org.testng.ITestContext context,
                                                     org.testng.xml.XmlTest xml)
        Runs before suite executes, during an execution this function will only be run once, before the first execution of the first method.
        Parameters:
        context - Contains all the information available on the test about to run.
        xml - Contains the XML configuration used in this testrun.

      • initSuite

        @BeforeTest(alwaysRun=true)
protected void initSuite(org.testng.ITestContext testContext,
                                                     java.lang.String propertiesFile,
                                                     java.lang.String configurationId)
        Automatically runs only once before executing the whole suite. It is used for instance to instantiate runtime environment, such as uploading the app to cloud services that might be used when running the test.
        Parameters:
        testContext - Provided by TestNG. Provides information about testrun.
        propertiesFile - Specified in the TestNG XML as a parameter named 'propertiesFile'. The actual file that is used need to be in the class path when running the test (preferably resources folder). If this value is not present in the XML or empty, the value for DEFAULT_PROPERTY_FILE will be used.
        configurationId - Specified in the TestNG XML as a parameter named 'configurationId'. The actual file that is used need to be in the class path when running the test (preferably resources folder). If this value is not present in the XML or empty, the value for DEFAULT_DRIVER_CONFIG will be used.

      • initTestClass

        @BeforeClass(alwaysRun=true)
protected void initTestClass(org.testng.ITestContext testContext,
                                                          java.lang.String propertiesFile,
                                                          java.lang.String configurationId,
                                                          java.lang.String debugLevel)
        Automatically runs before each class is created. Used among other to instantiate properties, webdrivers and credentials used during the test.
        Parameters:
        testContext - Provided by TestNG. Provides information about testrun.
        propertiesFile - Specified in the TestNG XML as a parameter named 'propertiesFile'. The actual file that is used need to be in the class path when running the test (preferably resources folder). If this value is not present in the XML or empty, the value for DEFAULT_PROPERTY_FILE will be used.
        configurationId - Specified in the TestNG XML as a parameter named 'configurationId'. The actual file that is used need to be in the class path when running the test (preferably resources folder). If this value is not present in the XML or empty, the value for DEFAULT_DRIVER_CONFIG will be used.
        debugLevel - Specified in the TestNG XML as a property with name 'automatedtesting.debug.level'.

      • beforeMethod

        @BeforeMethod(alwaysRun=true)
public void beforeMethod(org.testng.ITestContext context,
                                                       org.testng.xml.XmlTest xml,
                                                       java.lang.reflect.Method method,
                                                       java.lang.Object[] providerData)
        Runs before an actual testmethod executes. Sets the methodname for this specific testrun.
        Parameters:
        context - Contains all the information available on the test about to run.
        xml - Contains the XML configuration used in this testrun.
        method - Contains a prototype of the method about to run.
        providerData - Contains instances of objects instantiated by the dataprovider to the tests.

protected void closeWebDriver(org.testng.ITestResult testResult)
        Automatically runs after each method and tears down the webdriver.
        Parameters:
        testResult - Provided by TestNG. Provides information about the performed test.

      • closeSuite

        @AfterTest(alwaysRun=true)
protected void closeSuite()
        Automatically runs only once after executing the whole suite. It is used for closing any potential appium instance opened during the test suite.

        Throws:

      • getDefaultDriverConfig

        protected java.lang.String getDefaultDriverConfig()
        Get the default configuration ID for which webdriver to use. This is only used if no valid parameter was found in the TestNG XML file. Override this in the testcase in the project specific basetestcase if you prefer a different webdriver to be used by default.
        Returns:
        configuration id.

      • getDefaultPropertyFile

        protected java.lang.String getDefaultPropertyFile()
        Get the default path to the properties file. This is only used if no valid parameter was found in the TestNG XML file. Override this method in the project specific basetestcase if you prefer another default path.
        Returns:
        path to property file.

      • printAppiumLog

        protected boolean printAppiumLog()
        Override this function to specify if a generated appium log should be printed. If not overridden no log file wil be printed. To generate and print a appium log, turn on appium logging by sending appium server argument --log with the path to the root of the project and specify the appium log filename to start with "appium_log" when starting appium. Example: "--log c://projectDirectory/appium_log_MyAppiumLog.log"
        Returns:

      • getTestDataKey

        protected java.lang.String getTestDataKey()
        Override this function to specify data which the dataprovider should provide to the testcase. If not overridden no data will be fed to the test
        Returns:
        A key to a valid property in the property file used by the test

      • getWebDriverById

        protected org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver getWebDriverById(java.lang.String configurationId)
        Get a webdriver using a configuration id. NOTE: These webdrivers will automatically close after each test method.
        Parameters:
        configurationId - specifying which configuration to use from the driverconfiguration XML
        Returns:
        webdriver
